title: McKinsey Charged in South African Corruption Case
description: The South African branch of the global consulting firm has been charged in a corruption scandal related to its work with the country’s state-owned freight rail and port operator.

title: Putin Announces Ukraine Annexation, Calling West the Enemy
description: Declaring that Russia would annex four regions of Ukraine, which the West rejects as illegal, the Russian president accused the U.S. and its allies of “despotism’’ and “Satanism.’’

title: Yusuf al-Qaradawi, Influential Muslim Scholar, Dies at 96
description: Considered a moderate by some and an extremist by others, he backed political Islam, attacked Al Qaeda and dispensed advice in a TV show viewed by millions.

title: Russia Strikes Regions in Eastern Ukraine Then Declares Them Russian
description: The strikes killed a total of 30 civilians and wounded 107 in one of the bloodiest attacks in recent weeks.

title: Iran Soccer Stars Speak Out on Protests; Group Urges FIFA Ban
description: Some of the country’s most famous players have expressed support for street protests over the death of a young woman. On Thursday, an activist group went further: It asked FIFA to bar Iran from the World Cup.

title: Biden Warns Russia That the West Will Not Recognize Putin’s Actions
description: The president also said that Mr. Putin should not dare to take his fight into NATO territory, underscoring the unity among the alliance.

title: Ukraine Submits Application to Join NATO
description: Ukraine’s desire to join the alliance has long been a source of conflict with Russia, which sees the eastward expansion of NATO as a existential threat.

title: Truss Tried to Reassure Britons With Media Blitz. Her Woes Multiplied.
description: In a round of interviews, the prime minister showed little sympathy for the pain that high interest rates could inflict on mortgage holders, critics said.

title: Iran Protests Continue Despite Heavy Crackdowns
description: Dozens of people have been killed in nationwide demonstrations that erupted almost two weeks ago after Mahsa Amini, a 22-year-old woman, died in police custody.

title: Protests Erupt in Cuba Over Government Response to Hurricane Ian
description: Demonstrators in Havana blocked street traffic, chanting “we want the light.” Many were angry that the lack of electricity this week has rotted what little food they had stored.

title: U.K. Borrowers React to Soaring Interest Rates in Mortgage Market
description: The financial turmoil in Britain has led to soaring interest rates, prompting many lenders to withdraw products and stoking worry among homeowners about rising costs.

title: Despite international condemnation, Putin signs decrees declaring four regions of Ukraine part of Russia.
Ukraine Says 25 People Died in Attack on Civilians in Zaporizhzhia
description: People in the convoy were waiting to be allowed into Russian-occupied territory to pick up relatives and deliver humanitarian aid, a Ukrainian official said.

title: Britain Wonders, Is It Too Soon to Dramatize the Pandemic?
description: A new Sky Atlantic mini-series, “This England,” depicts the early days of Covid-19 in the country, with Kenneth Branagh playing Boris Johnson.

title: As Brazil Goes to the Polls, It’s the Far-Right Leader Versus a Former Leftist President
description: Jair Bolsonaro has questioned the integrity of Sunday’s election and trails in polls to Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, a leftist and former president, who was imprisoned amid a corruption scandal.

title: Gunfire Is Heard in Burkina Faso’s Capital, Kindling Fears of a Coup
description: The state broadcaster briefly went off the air, and soldiers blocked roads in Ouagadougou, the capital. But it was not immediately clear if elements of the military had seized power.

title: Gerrymandering, the Full Story
description: A Times analysis finds that the House of Representative has its fairest map in 40 years, despite recent gerrymandering.

title: As Putin Prepares to Illegally Annex Territory, Ukraine Is Hit With Deadly Strikes
description: One attack, on a civilian convoy, killed 25 people in the Zaporizhzhia region, Ukrainian officials said. In Moscow, an elaborate ceremony to absorb four Ukrainian regions is set for Friday, despite global condemnation.

title: Thai Prime Minister Can Stay in Power, Constitutional Court Rules
description: The former general seized power in a 2014 coup. The opposition had argued that the Constitution stipulated he leave office this year.

title: Blast at Education Center in Kabul Kills at Least 19
description: The violence was the latest to target the country’s Hazara ethnic minority and increased fears about the Taliban’s ability to provide security for all of their citizens.

title: The U.S. denounces Russia’s move to annex parts of Ukraine as a ‘land grab.’
China Gets Its First mRNA Vaccine Approval — in Indonesia
description: Indonesia has cleared an mRNA Covid-19 vaccine developed by a Chinese company. But those types of shots, considered among the most effective, aren’t yet available in China.

title: The Invisible Risks of a Town Ruined by Asbestos
description: Despite its deadly history, visitors continue to travel to the ghost town of Wittenoom.

title: Putin is expected to illegally annex Russian-occupied parts of Ukraine following sham votes.
With annexation plans, Putin escalates a battle of wills with the West.
A Year Under the Taliban
description: A single year of extremist rule has turned life upside down for Afghans, especially women. A photographer who has long called the country home captured the jarring changes.

title: Even as Iranians Rise Up, Protests Worldwide Are Failing at Record Rates
description: Mass protests, once a grave threat to even the fiercest autocrat, have plummeted in effectiveness, a study shows. Factors appear to include polarization, social media and rising nationalist attitudes.

title: French Feminist Rabbi Captivates Multifaith Crowds With Musings on Mortality
description: With Paris locked down over Passover, a rabbi started holding weekly talks over Zoom about Jewish texts. Thousands have tuned in to hear her reflections on death. “She is my rabbi,” said an atheist.

title: Countering China, the U.S. Signs a Broad Deal to Aid Pacific Nations
description: Beijing’s inroads in a strategic region are pushing the Biden administration to shore up withered ties.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: Russia moves to annex Ukrainian territory.

title: Putin Concedes That Some Men Were Wrongly Drafted
description: The Russian president’s remarks came after anger with the draft spilled over into street protests across Russia.
